column4: I want to install hunspell from source but it is giving error on make install
the error is : make: *** No rule to make target `install'.  Stop.
Please guide me what to do
have you read the instructions in INSTALL or README?

./configure, make, sudo make install is the normal way ie the way most source code is compiled.. but it's far from the only way.. there are other systems, ways and so on.. you need to read the incuded instructions when you compile source code
I had read and follow that instruction, still it is giving the same error
can you pastebin what happens when you run ./configure  make    sudo make install? including the commands
Config will giving error here is the config.log file I had pasted : http://paste.ubuntu.com/226900/
run this "sudo apt-get install build-essential", then try again
in some cases   ./configure actually creates the make files so if configure fails there might not be a make install rule
I have no idea why it does that..
config giving these warning  http://paste.ubuntu.com/227064/, so while giving make I am getting  error :http://paste.ubuntu.com/226945/
